benchmark_details.name: SearchInstruct
benchmark_details.overview: SearchInstruct is a novel framework for constructing high-quality instruction datasets for supervised fine-tuning (SFT) by combining targeted document retrieval with grounded answer generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of SearchInstruct is to enhance the generation of supervised fine-tuning datasets for large language models, particularly in specialized domains.

data.source: Generated from domain-specific queries and external documents retrieved from the web or APIs.
data.size: 8,932 instances in culinary and 7,560 instances in tourism domains
data.annotation: Automatically generated through query expansion and dynamic document retrieval.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of the model outputs in response to human-generated instructions and queries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in following user instructions accurately within specialized domains.
methodology.validation: Empirical evaluation through human annotators and comparative assessments of model performance.

harm: Risk of bias propagation from web-sourced documents.
